column4: How can I add my windows 7 partition in  the grub list? It's missing since I install natty :)
dirty way is to add it to your /etc/grub.d/40_custome file. but  just running sudo update-grub SHOULD find and add it automatically
the update does not :/

you may want to check the forums or the askubuntu.com site. they may have some tricks for making grub2 see the windows install. Its supposed to be seeing it.. but ive seen cases where it ignroes it for some reasion
some sort of bug in the os-prober tool. :(
I was hoping not to get my hands dirty :p
edit that file. add a entry that will load windows. :) but figureing out what to add can be the issue.
yep, that's kind of what I'm looking for ^_^
check someone elses grub.cfg to see what the tools normally ad. and cut/paste it
and change it as needed
menuentry "Windows 7 (loader) (on /dev/sda3)" {
insmod ntfs
set root=(hd0,2)
search --no-floppy --fs-uuid --set 861EF8FB1EF8E559
chainloader +1
what I've got for know,  but not sure avout search and root
!uuid
change the uuid@ to match your uuid
and  hd0,2 = the first hd. 2nd partition
good stuff, that's help a lot ;)
do I have to do an update to add the entry?
to generate a new grub.cfg you always have to run update-grub
